text: Pro's:+ The food at the restaurant. Although they have limited options, the food was delicious. The Spaghetti Bolognese was great! The food is also affordable. If you want to vary, try one of the restaurant on the beach (the one on the left side of the hotel is great! Forgot its' name, but it's not Antonio's) You can also order room service at the hotel, but if you pick up the food yourself at the restaurant (to eat in your apt) you save (i think) 5€. As we did this quite often (we have small kids) we saved the additional costs. We enjoyed eating at the apt as it is well equipped and we didn't have to worry about the kids.+ The 2 bedroom apartment was spacious and well designed. We were in the C block and had a great sea & beach view.+ The service: reception & restaurant employees were friendly and helpful.+ Location is relax - not close to the center. It's for people who want to relax and enjoy the beach (our case). If you want a busy nightlife, you should consider other accommodation.+ Furthermore, I had some problems with the reservation which would have financial impact on our side. Lana Martins helped me solving the problem. She was very attentive and helpful. She also replied the e-mails on quickly and offered great customer service. I'm sure that if it wasn't for her, my experience would be less positive and wouldn't consider going back.Con's:- Swimmingpools outside are lovely, but too cold.  (it could be that in August is it warmer?)- Did not see playground or a game room for kid for kids.In short: we had a great time! Loved Lagos, the beaches, the food and the accommodation. We would consider going back for sure!

It was our second time at artbeat. A perfect location in that beautiful city. The two host Gosia&Gosia See so nice and helpful. With check-in you get a self-created map of Lisbon with all their recommendations where to eat eg. This was very helpful and minimise the risk to get to an tourist-nap-restaurant. We will definately return.

This was our 5th time at the Belmar. Everything from the friendly, helpful staff to the cleanliness and attention to detail is top classWe were so glad that we were allowed use the spa facilities after check out as our flight was late in the eveningI would highly recommend a stay here at the Belmar

There's a part of me that wants to give this a 5/5, but there are certain things that won't let me do that.The reasons why this wasn't a perfect stay:-Booked a family deluxe room and were led to believe that they had sea views. They do not. This really made us feel like we overpaid significantly for this place.-Front desk staff act unapproachable and snooty, not too helpful.-Inconsistencies with breakfast staff on whether food items can be taken back to room (I had an ill wife who was too sick to be in the restaurant. First day, I was allowed to take a tray back, every other day, was not).Here's what went well:-Room quality was still very nice.-Room service food was the best we've ever had anywhere, and prices were actually reasonable.-Staff at pool, room service and housekeeping were extraordinarily friendly. These people (especially pool bar attendant Ricardo and room service delivery team member Carlos) saved the stay for us.-Great location.So yes, I have mixed feelings about our stay here. It might be a place I'd try again in the future if there's a sale or it's not high season. But there are definite areas for improvement.

Beautiful and spacious! We stayed in the three bedroom apartment. It was minutes from the beach. The pools were amazing as well! It had everything you needed: washer, full kitchen, hair dryer, dining room table and patio furniture. There was a restaurant and bar at the resort but also two other restaurants close by. We would definitely stay there again!

What a fabulous family hotel.I've just returned from a week long family holiday with grandparents, parents and children- 18 of us in total, including 9 children from 4 to 12. Jupiter Albufeira was the perfect choice.We booked all rooms direct with the hotel and were given a complimentary mini-bar, topped up daily. The rooms are all absolutely fantastic. Beautiful large modern rooms, good sized bathrooms and lovely walk in overhead showers. The rooms were cleaned daily and all towels replaced daily (although I'd have been happy if they were only changed every other day).The cleanliness and upkeep of the hotel is brilliant, with staff working around the clock to keep the place clean and tidy.The highlight of the hotel is the food. The main dining restaurant, whilst quite canteeny in appearance with tables all clinically in a straight line, is brilliant. Yes, it's busy at times and we saw the odd queue forming with people waiting to get in and to a table, however we just had another drink at the bar before the queue disappeared. The food and selection of food is brilliant.Breakfast has a main station packed full of fresh sliced fruits (the fresh slides oranges were insane), cheeses, hams, yogurts, cereal, pancakes, fruit juices, honey from a dripping honeycomb, breads, pastries and cakes. There is then a hot station where you can get a full english, with various types of eggs on offer, and also hot porridge (I heard it was brilliant).Lunch and dinner has a large array of fresh salad items and mixed salads (think waldorf salad, pasta salads, potato salads, bean salads) which change daily and lots salad dressings and fresh bread. The hot station always has at least 2 types of fresh fish and lots of meat options available. There is also a veggie section at meal sittings with numerous hot options. Each evening there is also a theme section- I think we had Portugese, Asian, Mexican, Surf and Turf, among others. At lunch and dinner you could get beer and wine served at the table, however we tended to just walk up to the bar and pour a red, white or sparkling ourselves when passing. All wines in the hotel are bottled. All the kids in our company are brilliant eaters, so they tended to eat a bot of everything, however there was a kids section with chicken nuggets and chips if sardines, salmon and prawns isn't their thing. There was also a brilliant Italian section in the restaurant that made pizza and pasta to order from about 3/4pm.As we booked direct with the hotel we also had the opportunity to visit to of the hotels other restaurants free of charge- a Brazilian Rodizio and the a-la-carts. Both were absolutely brilliant and well recommended.The staff in the hotel were brilliant. Always smiling and helpful. They are all a credit to the hotel.Whilst the weather wasn't the best, we had 9 very active children with us, none of whom were bored for a minute. With the weather not being the best the kids didn't go near the pool much, however they had endless fun going up and down the water slides, whilst also spending a huge amount of time in the all weather sports court playing football and basketball. There was always a huge crowd of boys and girls of all nationalities playing together and making friends.Next to the football pitch there was a good wee bar area that was a help yourself beer, cider and sangria. The bar also had a fridge packed with fresh sandwiches and pasta pots you could help yourself to throughout the day, whilst you could also get ice-cream and crisps in here for the kids.I visited the gym several times and it is a very very well equipped gym with everything from running, cycling and rowing machines, to weights, free weights and warm up area.If you are looking for a nice family holiday, I cannot recommend this hotel enough.

We spent 5 days in a three bedroom condo.  The condo was spacious, clean, and very comfortable for our family.  We each had a balcony off our rooms and two bathrooms to share.  We did not have the best views but we were still happy with our condo. We only had cleaning once and had to ask for more soap and toilet paper from the front desk which they provided for us.  We washed our own towels in the washing machine provided.  It would have been nice to have more regular cleaning but not a big deal.    There were three pools to choose from, a gym, spa and easy 5 min walk to another beautiful beach.  The spa and gym was a great feature to have and the yoga class was awesome.  The nearby beach was beautiful to walk on but the ocean is too cold to swim in for my taste.  Having the large outdoor pool was great as the days were very warm.    We had a car so that we could drive to nearby Sagres to do some surfing.  We were 10 minutes drive from Lagos where we enjoyed many restaurants including great Chinese food, seafood and Italian food.  The concierge made reservations for us everyday.  The town was very cool to walk around in.   Besides surfing we enjoyed horseback riding, wandering around town, and took a boat trip to see the beautiful coast and grottos (I recommend smaller boats).  We ate breakfast and lunches at the hotel.  Lunch was very good.  Breakfast was okay and got a little busy.  You had to wait in line for coffee which could be annoying.

The hotel is right on the beach and we had a sea view room with fantastic views.  The room was absolutely outstanding with plenty of room for hanging clothing, a walk in shower, which was lovely, a safe and fridge.  The first thing that you notice when you go into the room is the size of the double bed, huge and very comfy. It was all very clean and room service come in every day to clean and make up the bed. We stayed on half board basis and I have to say the food was very good and most tastes we catered for.

hotel_name: Dona Filipa Hotel Vale Do Lobo
text: This is the 3rd time we have been here and the standards have always been excellent.Location is fantastic - 20 mins from airport and right next to the sea.The praca is excellent for restaurants and the local golf course is superb.The staff are friendly and attentive.The standards throughput the hotel are excellent.

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & Châteaux
text: The Valverde is a superb choice for those who appreciate competent, friendly service and outstanding comfort without unneeded glitz. Well located and always ready to be of assistance to guests. We highly recommend to those who are looking for real substance.

hotel_name: Quinta Nova Winery House - Relais & Châteaux
text: Great location, beautiful views but the hotel itself could be better for the price they charge. The rooms are very comfortable and nicely decorated. The restaurant is very average and expensive. The vegetarian option was essentially an egg and a stuffed tomato with salad which while nice was certainly not worth 46€. At breakfast the the staff were slow to take orders from our table for hot food. The wine is super as is the tour of the vineyard. The service is good but was not remarkable. Overall for the price we paid I certainly didn't think it was worth it but I did enjoy my stay none the less.

hotel_name: Dona Filipa Hotel Vale Do Lobo
text: Have stayed at Dona Filipa for many years despite renovations heavily in progress our stay was still a pleasurable experience . The pool was a great miss but if your a golfer it's not the end of the day staff and management did their utmost to make the holiday a success even providing extra relaxation areas in the gardens and many more extras to make our stay first class .Given the conditions the staff have at present they are to be commended always putting the guest first.

Have just returned from the worst 5 day holiday break ever. The pool area was blasted with very loud Techno style music non stop and unavoidable anywhere in the pool area due to 2 large speakers mounted on the bar shed. For a supposed 5 star resort it was unacceptable and if the barman was asked to turn it down he sometimes did - temporarily.  We stay at other 5 star resorts and they wouldn't dream of submitting their customers to this sort of music,in fact none that we visit have any intrusion in the pool area. We have just spoken to a friend who is still there who said that after someone complained to the manageress the music was stopped for 2 days but has now restarted. They're there for 2 weeks, best of luck to them. So if you want a relaxing quiet holiday go somewhere else.

I ghetto a lot the dancers achou NIRMA,CINDER,YOANDRI,LEYANNA and director LAURO dance very well they are very professional they have an impressive charisma very good attention from SUMALIA I will definitely come back thank you so much for this unforgettable night

Great place, Tahir was especially great at the Pool Bar!The hotel was great and food was very good and was a good selection for all inclusive.I would happily recommend to any friends or family looking for somewhere to stay.

hotel_name: Dona Filipa Hotel Vale Do Lobo
text: Just got back from a long weekend. We stayed 4 nights and we had a truly wonderful time. The staff could not do enough for us and were always smiley and very friendly. We only ate breakfast and lunches at the hotel so cant comment on the restaurants but what we did eat and drink was great....the cheeseburger with mushrooms was delicious.....I don't even like burgers....Anyway, long and short of it....great hotel, great staff, rooms were spacious and recently given a face lift....Couldn't fault anything...We cannot wait to go back....

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & Châteaux
text: This is a lovely boutique hotel in a great location with stellar staff.  Every staff member we encountered was friendly and accommodating.  The staff made you feel welcome and at home from the second you walked through the door.Crystelle, at front desk, was extremely nice and helpful.  She made dinner reservations for us and helped us plan our daily activities.  She always greeted us with a smile and we loved chatting with her.The restaurant/bar/garden area on the lower level is absolutely delightful (as is the adjoining reading room).  The dining/patio area provides a very comfortable space for breakfast.  The breakfast buffet consisted of meats and cheeses, fresh fruits, cereals, yogurt and baked goods.  Several fresh juice options were available each day.  And you also have the option to order hot dishes like eggs or pancakes, which are made to order.  It is also a lovely space to sit with a cocktail in the afternoon and unwind from a day spent exploring the city.  Finally, they host live music several nights a week – which also make this an excellent spot to go after dinner.Mario, the bar manager, was wonderful.  He was so very friendly and passionate about mixology.  He shared some fabulous cocktail recipes with my husband (who fancies himself a mixologist).  He and the entire bar staff checked on us constantly to ensure that we were content.The basic room is not huge but it is very comfortable.  It has a great bathroom with a wonderful shower. The bed is very comfortable and there’s plenty of closet and dresser space available.  They provide every guest with a cell phone to use during their stay.  While we did not use the phone, we nevertheless thought that this was a lovely touch.  There are also additional nice touches, like leaving fresh fruit in our room on the day of our arrival, as well as cookies each night at turndown service.All in all, we loved our time at Valverde and hope to visit again someday soon.  Thanks for an excellent stay.

We had a great time! Room absolutely perfect, best and comfiest bunk beds ever. Staff is really friendly and relaxed always helpful and cool. Super breakfast, good hangout area. Building is super central and like a Palace!!!!

there's not much to say, except: GREAT :)it's one of those places you're allways looking forward coming back another time. it's not just about the the hostel itself.. it's more the whole package of the house, the super friendly owners and all the other guests who are soooo relaxed because there's nothing to compain about.thanx for the stays. see you again hopefully

This was our first time visiting Portugal. Have booked to go back this June but not to this hotel! Clubs oceano hotel was a massive let down. On arrival we were given a ground floor, self catering apartment. There was blood spattered on one of the walls; hair ( as in a clump that  you would pull off from your brush) sat beside the tv. Coffee rings on all of the work surfaces. Mould on the prints/pictures on the walls. The pool had a slick of sun cream/ oil on the surface, so you ended up coming out of the pool with more protection, than when you went in! Better use of the shower maybe, before entering.We pointed out our room issue immediately and was offered an equally tired looking room - minus the blood spatters!The staff were friendly but this just wasn't good enough after such a bad start.

Booked here after seeing hotel on Internet. Lovely hotel, superb views and every member of staff we met was very friendly and helpful. Restaurant was excellent, very good breakfast. Also some worthwhile events, eg wine presentation was very good. Hotel provided packed lunch and if you had the vegetarian option it was free! The Hotel is on the N coast and slightly remote, so a hire car is, I think, essential. Scenery around the island is wonderful.

Average, comfotable accomodations.  The staff was superb, like the nice gentleman who helped up take our bags to our room.  Upon learning that it was our anniversary, he congratulated us.  About 30 minutes later, room service came to our room with fresh egg custards and a bottle of ruby port - on the house - to congratulate us.  One of the bellmen made sure to tell our cab driver exactly where to take us in downtown Lisbon so we could see the best of the city and shop.  They helped us get a reservation at a great restaurant for our anniversary dinner.  Would definitely stay here again because of the attentiveness of the staff.  Thanks again for a great experience.

Stayed here last June. Hotel had recently opened so everything was spotless. Room was fantastic, had a great bath tub too which was great for a soak after long days of walking. Drinks at the bar were spot on. Great location for exploring Lisbon.

Good location. 10 min walk to metro. 20 min drive or 30 min on metro to airport. Great rooms, good service and great executive lounge breakfast and snacks. Close by driving to different sights by car and taxi but Lisbon is a big city and you need to be able to walk the metros or then hire a car. We did both.

Nice little place. No children under 16 allowed so nice if that's for you. Pool area is sweet, with a little cozy area that you can chill in the shade if you wish, Reception is across the road but the people are lovely. Carla and the other chap are so friendly and helpful. You cant fault them.Wifi is a bit hit and miss in some of the rooms. We either had to sit on the toilet to get it in our room or just go to the pool area.Cleaning was a bit of a let down. We stayed for 2 weeks but the cleaners only came in 3 times, although we did have absolutely everything needed for a self contained holiday. The rooms had air con, so this is a plus. Overall, a decent place with just a few possible improvements that could be made

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: Wonderful hotel with great hospitality and service. The food quality was excellent and the hotel offered great value for money.

Definitely the best hostel I've ever stayed in! It's clean, the people who work there are really friendly and organise things for everyone to do, the food is great, there's a pool, and best of all, it's super sociable and fun! It felt like one big happy family as everyone goes for dinner, to bars, surfing together, and the hostel also organises things like BBQs and pool parties.I did 3 days of surfing, which I felt was a good amount over a week, as it meant I could relax and explore Lagos' beautiful beaches on the other days. The surf school instructors are great and I really enjoyed my first surfing experience.Don't worry about staying here on your own as you will make friends straightaway! I remember seeing a review from another girl saying that if you are even thinking about going, just do it! And I couldn't agree more; I'm so glad I went. I really didn't want to leave and will definitely be back!

The casa Mitchell are ideally situated in the old town of albuferia, a few minutes walk down to beach and main streets, down hill and along cobble paths but we walked on the road as not many vehicles coming along, plenty of restaurants to suit all pockets we had a special meal at the Altrium, beautiful Portuguese restaurant we booked a table on the night a singer was there, excellent meal. The appartments were huge, ours was a studio on the ground floor facing the pool, the bathroom was abit dated but hey you’re on holiday who cares, it was functional, toilet paper couldn’t be flushed down the loo but put in a bin,but we are use to that as we holiday a lot in Greece parts of which still do this,  this is a very quiet place to stop and very relaxing , we enjoyed some lunches and of course our nighttime brandy and coffee at Leo’s across the road to the appartments, very reasonable prices, overall the holiday was a peaceful and relaxing week away, eating, walking and drinking, would we go back again. Yes definitely!

Fully booked hotel. Expected our room to have a sea view (as website had suggested). Put in a ground floor room with a view of shrubbery and little else.First day was spent trying to get the room ‘working’. Air conditioning was not cooling the air, toilet extractor wasn’t, odd smell of urine at entrance to room, Wi-fi didn’t reach as far as our dark and dingy room. Asked for another room but was told hotel full.Evening 3, just after getting to sleep we were awoken by a loud noise from above ceiling level - thought an air conditioning pipe had come loose. Maintenance came quickly to sort the problem. Turns out it was a ventilation pipe that came on at various times to vent somewhere or other. After 30 minutes it stopped. Maintenance pointed out the odd smell at the entrance to the room (now stronger since the vent pipe had vented). Telephone reception and demanded we be allocated another room the next day. Once more told that the hotel was full.Moved the next to a room that was just what we had expected when booking. Suggested our old room needed sorting before letting other use it - certainly not fit in our view. Told the room was being reallocated straight away as hotel full.The rest of our stay was pleasant, although we noticed lots of large cracks in plaster work throughout the hotel. On last day parents with children  began to takeover the main pool. Even after official evening closure they returned and could be seen and heard with large balls / floats playing till late.Won’t be returning ever!

We had a very lovely relaxed time. The design of the hotel is beautiful, and customer service was excellent. Rooms were very comfortable.Breakfast buffet was great, but wouldn’t have wanted to do half board, hotel restaurants were fine, but better (and cheaper) options at nearby marina. But the variety of different spaces to eat and drink is excellent, and all very comfortable.Only real downside was the weather which wasn’t as good as we’d hoped - warm but very cloudy. But that meant the hotel wasn’t as busy which was a bonus. Will definitely be back.

The site is big, the toilets and showers cleaned 3 times a day. The site is a little tired and could do with new management who might tidy it up a bit. Maybe a light bright reception area and some attention to fittings around the site.All in all a good site, laid back, just a short walk to Albufeira town, maybe 15 minutes. Very good supermarket just down the road. The on site restaurant has new management, they are very friendly and the food is good.There are many 'residents' who live in small park areas around the site, they help give the site some life as the site only has around 30 touring caravans and motorhomes otherwise in November.Make sure you go to Albufiera shopping centre, it is about 5/10 minutes from the site on the Lagos road, the food hall has a good chinese buffett.This is a good camping site which is dearer than the Aire up the road but has free wifi, security at night and a bar/restaurant. If you have a dog this is a good site for you.

First time in Portugal. If visiting Lisbon again would definitely stay here again, superbly comfortable beds, everything extremely clean. All the staff very friendly and helpful,The Breakfast couldn’t be faulted, huge choice of every type of food for breakfast, & freshly cooked eggs on request.Very conveniently located, if not wanting to walk up the hilly streets, Uber taxis very cheap to drop you off anywhere.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: Reid's is a great palace exulting with vintage charm, but also nicely renovated. The estate is built on a stiff cliff, with a magnificent view over the deep blue ocean, with Funchal hills on the left. Be sure to ask for a room with sea view. Mine is in the recent wing, a little bit small to my taste, but with a nice terrace looking over the sea. Wifi is very good, rapid. Non alcoholic beverages in room are complementary but surprisingly there is no coffee or tea offered !The pool area is very pleasant, impeccable grass, boasting 2 classic pools, of which one filled with salty water. Pool service is OK, but I would appreciate more if it had been accompanied with small signs of attention such as, but not limited to, fresh towel, fresh fruit slices, ice cream... which I always experienced in other resorts I visited. There is also a sundeck and another small pool at sea level, from where you can plunge down into the sea. The hotel garden is also very beautiful and relaxing, plenty of flowers and exotic trees and plants.The Reid's has 2 restaurants, one named Villa Cipriani serving decent italian food and the other named William serving excellent and very innovative cuisine - it is Michelin-starred recently. And I forget the delightful bar lounge terrace where you can take a mid-afternoon tea break, while contemplating the seascape.The hotel has also spa and fitness facilities but I have not tested them.Service is OK in general, up to the standard of the hotel, although I have noticed that some staff are grumpy and not entirely friendly.All in all I would recommend this hotel if you visit Madeira and Funchal.

We were pleased with our hotel choice in Lisbon. Nearest metro station is quite close to hotel and conection to airport with metro is fast, although You must change train once. Also city center is within suitable walking distance (about 2 km), if You want to excercise walking.Hotel rooms are stylish and clean, although photo picture in wall of our room was a bit odd. Sound isolation is good and we slept very well our nights in good bed. Internet connection worked fine, as well as showers with excellent water pressure.Buffet breakfast was ok although maybe a small disappointment to us. We typically try to choose hotels with many-sided buffet breakfast included to room price. This time selection was quite far away from top of our ranking and especially choice of warm dishes was very limited. But we got however stomach full from breakfast room.Personnel in reception was friendly and helpful, waiters in reastaurant a bit less maybe.Overall price/quliaty ratio is good i this hotel, at least now in Autumn season.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: Reid's Palace is a hotel not quite like any other. There is a unique mix of tradition and modern amenities, with everything you need and want: breathtaking view, outstanding service, excellent food in restaurant \William\"
extracted_date_str: and tremendous personality. Any downs? Well
column12: could definitely do with some renovation. Apart from that
column14: keeping its soul and old world charm
column15: as I am confident the owners know. I will be back."

text: We loved this hotel during our recent trip to Lisboa! The staff and service were amazing, wonderful food and the room was beautiful! We had a great experience at the spa and ate at the hotel several times as the food was so good. Wouldn’t hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone!

1st solo trip and I was so pleased I picked this hotel. When I 1st checked I I was given a room in K block which  was a good walk away and from  all the amenities, however I informed reception I was unhappy, immediately I was given another room overlooking the pool (520) I was delighted. I think it was Pauli and Rodrigo, and the manager that helped me. (Not good with names sorry)The resort is feet away from the beach and 1st night I sipped sangria watching the most amazing sunset. I was only self catering so couldnâ€™t comment on the food etc.  Rooms were clean and well equipped and for what I paid it was well worth the money. The entertainment team Boris and the girl were amazing, and really friendly, I even learnt how to make cocktails lol. I would come here again.. same room please Xx

I stayed at this hotel in June when it wasn't full and it was amazing - I then gave a 5/5 review.  The difference when I have just stayed is that the hotel was full and there wasn't enough staff working to give 5 star service.  Breakfast tables outside just sat after people had left and remained dirty until you asked one of the 2 staff working out there if they could clear one for you.  Not good sitting surrounded by dirty tables for a 5 star hotel.  Service at the pool bar was great - however when I visited in June staff would come round to your sunbeds to collect drinks orders - never saw this in September.  Trying to get a drink in the main bar was really hard when you go to the bar they tell you to take a seat but then it took ages for anyone to come and collect your order.  You now have to get your towels from reception which is ridiculous as it causes huge queues and you are queuing behind people checking out - they should return to getting your beach towels from the beach bar.  6 reception desks but only 2 ever manned and more staff never appeared to help when there were long queues which was 75% of the time.Such a shame as a lovely hotel but need more staff when hotel is full.  I return again next month - hopefully things will have improved again and be like they were in June.

Spectacular cocktails, besides, Boris has a gift of languages, he speaks the language you want, he is a machine, we have been watching his cocktails and they are spectacular, he is a guy of 100000, now I roll a little more than I have to write 200 characters

I stayed here with my two adult daughters from Friday to Monday. We arrived at the hotel just after 11am and were delighted that our room was ready. Check in was swift.Our room was on the 8th floor and had a partial sea view. The room was spacious enough to hold the extra bed as the 3 of us were sharing a room. Beds were comfy, good size balcony and plenty of space to store clothes etc.It was let down though by not having a mirror in the bedroom, not even a small one, whereas there were 3 in the bathroom...I was also very disappointed that upon Arrival the lovely porter explained that we could use any card in the electric switch and that it didn’t have to be a room key. It worked so that was great, but not so great that it went missing when we returned to the room the day before we were leaving.. thankfully it wasn’t a bank card but a loyalty card with points on. I rang down to reception to ask if they could check with house keeping if they’d taken it by mistake and they said they’d check and call me back, but didn’t..Also you are provided with a bottle of water each day per person and one day one of my daughters left her bottle of water beside the bed which had a third left in it and so house keeping only left us 2 that day.... pretty petty.Breakfast was very good, plenty of choice and a lovely light and spacious dining room. A great extra touch was the table set up outside the restaurant with tea, coffee and a few cakes etc to take away, great added bonus!The pool is big with plenty of sun beds so even on arrival day we didn’t get to the pool until mid day and we still found  three beds. We had a delicious pizza there and cocktails served by a charming young waitress. It’s a really nice clean pool area, thumbs up!We were unable to keep our room past mid day on check out day but could use the spa showers which you have to book and pay for - 5 euros per person. You are provided with a towel and there’s all in one shampoo/body wash pumps but nothing else as you normally get in spas like cotton pads, cotton buds, shower caps etc.. bring your own stuff in with you..It’s a minute walk to the beach and the beach is gorgeous! Sun beds were 20 euros for two with an umbrella or 28.50 for three with the brolly. Walking to the marina takes 10 minutes max and is full of restaurants and bars..There’s a spa shop 5 min walk - buy your water etc there!We thoroughly enjoyed our stay despite my little grumbles and would return.

Lovely Hotel ðŸ‘Great StaffðŸ‘Apartment offers everything you need for a self catering holiday, very clean & well equipped.A great base for Bars and Restaurants.Pool is a good size but not great for swimming due to being sectioned off.Although Natura's write up states they have a \No stags or hens\" policy
month: during our 2 weeks stay we experienced a number of these
year: particularly Thursday's to Monday's which wasn't great as their language was awful & they tended to take over the pool with ball games & were fairly noisy late at night/ early hours
extracted_date_str: that said we approached management & they are taking this forward to resolve those issues.Despite the negatives we still had a great stay here and a wonderful holiday. Thank you Natura."

text: Excellent facilities, friendly staff, beautiful rooms, fantastic food, reasonable prices, can’t fault any of it!Rooms were spacious with good toiletries. Wonderful sea view and great pools, although it was a little cold in February. Food was excellent, tasty and well presented. Staff were approachable and happy to serve. Buffet was great with a good variety of food. Alcohol was reasonably priced. A fab holiday.

I did enjoy the hotel, its facilities, and location and staff, but for the last day of our Algarve holiday, staying in and eating the only available 22 euro set meal was a disaster, it was without doubt the poorest 3 course meal I have ever had. On top of that I ordered a bottle of wine, which arrived open with another cork was corked with bits floating in it. A second bottle they broke the cork too, a third was finally drunk but was the poorest tasting wine. they need to review their list, as Portugal make some great wines, So do go, enjoy your stay, and EAT OUT, p.s. the wifi was painfully slow

Excellent location but the smallest rooms I have ever stayed in and we have travelled a lot. For comparison, it was smaller than our cruise ship cabin (with balcony). Hotel otherwise is quaint and staff is very helpful.Lot of choices of restaurants.

Food ,staff,,pool , great !!lovely clean modern rooms ,food great wine fantastic , what can you say , good place to be just enough distance from marina to walk to , wifi all over hotel ,if want quite place this is good place out of main season , and once the golfers go in morning can't ask for better relaxing hotel

We stayed at Albergeria Dias for a week through the 2015 New Year celebrations. The hotel is perfectly located in the old town area of Funchal. Staff were excellent, friendly and welcoming.  The room was perfect for us; spaceous and clean. Breakfasts were great with an excellent selection and choice of delicious foods. All guests were invited to the top floor balcony to watch the spectacular firewook display on New Years Eve, with sparkling wine and cakes provided. Altogether a memorable holiday.
Excellent hotel.  Wonderful front desk staff especially Franciso and Rita.Walking distance to all Belem sights.View of Discovery Monument from our room.Shuttle to take guests to the center of Lisbon.

It was a good stay with car parking and lovely view from our room. Clean bathrooms and a good property, helpful staff members. The only thing we didn’t like was the centrally controlled temperature in all rooms. It was a little too warm for us.

We own a property on perola so may be a little biased. It has lots of access points to the lagoon and only a 5 minute drive from the beach and nearby cafes and restaurants. There are villas to hire here and easy access to peniche (25 mins), Praia del Rey (10 mins), baleal (25 mins) and the lourinha (30 mins). Great base to explore the silver coast.Golf course of Bom Sucesso, silver cliffs, PDR and royal obidos are within 5 mins drive.

It's been years in the making, and we finally got to experience the Wonderful Altis Belem. Everything was great, the room, the view, the food, both breakfast and dinner that we had as room service.the friendliness of all the staff we talked to that really go the extra mile. We had an electric car that they volunteer to put to charge, we had to leave at 5am as our flight was delayed and they prepared lunch boxes for us to eat. It was all delightful.We will definitely go back

lovely hotel we all the amenities that you need on your doorstep .The hotel shares a pool with a adjoining hotel so could be a little packed but most of us spent our days at either of the two lovely sandy beeches within walking distance or a 5 euro taxi ride away.The supermarket is across  the road as we did self catering  and found this worked for us even though you had the option to eat in the restaurant and have the breakfast for 7 euros , they even had a buffet in the evenings but we preferred to walk along the strip enjoying the different types restaurants around .excursions are available and we did do some that were reasonable in price .The rooms had lots of space for us  they were clean and comfy and air conditioning was a great plus in the heat , the rooms were cleaned daily and nothing was too much trouble for the staff . Very friendly and lovely place would go back .

hotel_name: Porto PalÃ¡cio Hotel by The Editory
text: Stayed there for 5 nights City break and enjoyed it totally.Friendly reception manager, attention to detail chamber maid as well as breakfast staff made our stay very pleasant. You can even get champagne for breakfast in this hotel!!! It's part of the breakfast at no extra. Breakfast choices covers traditional English breakfast, local delicious pastry, healthy mix fruit yoghurt, fruits, varieties of meats, cheese board, cereals and so much more. The only thing to need to remind them when you order coffee or tea is to get them bring some milk as I think local like it as it is. :DRoom is very spacious and bed is very comfortable. The hotel offers you choices of pillows you can sleep with or the default that's already there. I like that idea. There's nothing to fault about the room and the view.Restaurant is on level 18 with an outside area you can sit out. Even better view when you are out there. Complimentary Port wine was delicious!!!The hotel is a walkable 20 mins from the nearest metro station Casa De Musica. Taking a taxi is not too expensive and there Uber service in Porto that can help you too.Perfect time to visit Porto this time of year and it has the sunshine, beautiful autumn colours begin, still warm enough and it's harvest time which is great to visit vineyards at Duoro Valley.Hope you will enjoy this place and hotel as much as we did.

We LOVED this hotel! The hotels for the rest of our trip just couldn't compare. The staff was so welcoming from the moment we walked in. She took the time to explain the room and also recommend a few places to visit. The room was clean and had everything you could want. The breakfast was better than most restuarants. My partner is still talking about her eggs nearly two weeks later. Finally, the location is extremely convienent for anything and everything you could want to visit in Porto.

This trip is an annual event for us and we look forward to it each year. A stay with Jill and Julio provides a host of happy memories and, on dining in evenings, good food and conversations with the other guests.

Just returned from staying at the Albergaria Dias, great hotel.  Rooms are clean, linen changed everyday. Hotel is quiet and comfortable.  Staff are brilliant really friendly and helpful.  Breakfast is great a variety of natural fruit juices, great fruit salad and a lovely passion fruit mousse homemade. Good location close to restaurants in the old town.  Can't say enough about this lovely hotel.  Thanks for a great holiday.  Hope to return next year.

I stayed in the Yes! Hostel in February with a group of 40 people. I think we only paid 8 or 9 euros a night breakfast included. What you get for this price is really unbelievable. Rooms are very clean and practical. (They don't forget the little things which make your stay much more comfy, like curtains around your bed, a nightlamp, ...) Showers are very clean (and beautiful also). There is a VERY cheap bar, to give you an example, sangria costs 1 euro.We really loved Yes! Hostel, and I would recommend it to everyone.

The location of the hotel is breathtaking. The hotel itself is beautiful and the rooms we had were very nice and spacious, with a magnificent view of the sea. The staff was very friendly and helped us whenever necessary. We are looking forward to coming back to Pestana Bahia Praia, Praia de Agua d'Alto, one day.

A well located hotel, comfortable and an excellent cleanliness.It should improve the acoustics of the rooms, as you hear the noise in the adjacent rooms as well as in the hallway.I highlight the professionalism and availability of the employees.I used the gym, which because it was separated by glass from the indoor pool, was too hot.

We were referred to this B and B by a restaurant owner in the town. It is a little gem. Very comfortable, clean and the lady that runs the hotel is beautiful. She is amazing. It is a family run B and B and you will find it difficult to get better. 40 EURO a night. The lady is very Portuguese and cannot speak English. We loved it because of the charm of the hotel, the rooms and the owner.

Absolutely fantastic holiday experience at the Cliff Bay hotel in Funchal.Firstly, what a beautiful island with an array of flowers, plants, shrubs and trees, a photographic paradise.The pavements and general area of Funchal is immaculately clean, no litter,  no graffiti,  no dog excrement,  so walking around is a pleasure.Many areas of interest  to visit and great restaurants where you can have meals, snacks and drinks without feeling 'ripped off'. The locals are rightly proud of where they  live and it shows in their happy demeanour.And now our hotel ... First Class in every way.  Amazingly friendly and helpful staff, reception, housekeeping,  bars and restaurant and all who played their part, such a credit to the owners and management of the Cliff Bay.We relaxed, had wonderful meals here, all of which were delicious and presented like a work of art.So thankyou to Madeira,  thankyou to the Cliff Bay. We will return.

We loved this hotel. Staff were very friendly and efficient. Breakfast room was very bright and selection of food was very good. Hotel right beside a tube stop which was very useful for getting around all the sights. Brilliant large shopping centre just around the corner as well with a great tapas bar.

Stayed here on a city break and to celebrate my wife’s 50th. Hotel was excellent value for money. Booked as bed and breakfast as we wanted to explore Lisbon and not be tied down. There are plenty of places to eat nearby from the reasonable to the expensive. Food at the hotel was good and we had one dinner there as well and thought it was excellent value. Staff were friendly and courteous and the hotel was spotless. Booked a superior room with double bed and it was clean and comfortable.

hotel_name: Quinta do Morgado - Monte da Eira Apartments
text: The stay was going to be good, until the fridge crashed on the eve of my son's birthday and most of the food we had bought and cooked for a party of 50 people spoil. The policy of not letting them use baby safety boils also doesn't make much sense to me

This clean, conveniently-located hotel is cost-effective and welcoming.The staff went out of their way to accommodate us with wine glasses for us to have wine the lobby.Parking is off site, but you can unload and load right in front.  Many nice restaurants are within a stones throw from the front door of Hotel Mare.  You can't go wrong here.

We arrived at Cascais the 25 of April after a quite difficult drive from Lisbon where they celebrated the Carnation Revolution 50th anniversary. Almost every street were blocked, but our excellent Shuttle service driver Nono transported us safely to Casa Vela Guest House. We were welcomed by Milene Cruz who took good care of us, and gave us a tour around this charming house and garden. The whole place feels like a private home with a freshly baked cake every day and the cozy three legged cat Mia.There is an honest bar where you can pour a drink if you like, and just write your room number. Lovely garden and a big swimming pool and only 10 minutes walk to the centre of Cascais. We had the smallest room and would have liked a slightly larger bed, but the view was very nice. Next time we will stay longer than two days!

Excellent hotel with really friendly, helpful staff. Lovely breakfast with a great selection of food each morning. Situation across the road from the metro station allowed easy access to centre of Lisbon. Very quiet hotel even with it's City centre location. Extremely good value for money, highly recommended.

We went for a 3 days stay. We booked a room suite. First one was not so comfortable due to a strange noise that came from somewhere in the building. A low volume annoying noise. We requested to change to another room and the staff was kind to quickly solve the problem getting us another suite, although the hotel was near 100% full. Breakfast was very good with a lot of good options as used to be usual in Vila Gale hotels chain.

I have visited Carvoeiro many times but always  around the bottom of restaurant Hill. We were  delighted with the location of the apartment and the variety of bars,restaurants and shops  so close to the location and yet although busy outside ,when around the pool it was a peaceful oasis.Everything was clean and the viewsurrounding from apartment 8 were beautiful.All amenities are in walking distance,including the popular beach and a beach I had never come across before a little walk away down from the centre.We were so happy with everything we have booked for  14 days next year.
I would like to thank Catarina for her ability to resolve my complex mobile phone and internet issue efficiently and professionally.

We stayed at the Bellevue Apartments at the end of June and what a wonderful time we had. Based on the ground floor in apartment 12, we had an extremely spacious room complete with two single beds made into a double, a kitchen, living room area with sofas and TV, bathroom with shower and bath, and a small front terrace. Our room was cleaned twice in a week, with bins emptied and towels refreshed.As many others have said, Dieter and Sigi are very pleasant and approachable, as were the maids.  We were given a warm welcome on arrival and this was only improved by the other guests staying at Bellevue who gave the place a real sense of community (especially since it is only a small set of apartments).The pool area was lovely and cleaned daily. Sunbeds complete with parasols (which in the heat of June offered a welcome respite from the sun!).Local area very nice with plenty of bars and restaurants just a short walk away. Mini supermarket only across the road from Bellevue which came in handy for stocking up on lunch and a daily afternoon icecream. Beach a 15 minute walk from the apartments. Make sure you go on the boardwalk around sunset for beautiful views!Only two (very minor) complaints about the room - the beds were a bit too hard for my liking and there wasn't a dressing table area, so I ended up putting a chair in front of a full length mirror behind the front door to do hair and makeup. There is a good mirror in the bathroom however if you don't mind doing these things standing up.Another thing to mention, if you are a light sleeper then you may be bothered by the noise of the seagulls (since Carvoeiro is a fishing village). I took a good set of ear plugs which helped enormously.All in all a fantastic holiday and we wouldn't hesitate to recommend Bellevue to others!Thank you Dieter and Sigi =).
